💡 Hint 1:  Hey there!  See those numbers, 45 and 30?  Why don't you add them together first to make the problem a little simpler?
💡 Hint 2:  Hey there!  See those two numbers, 45 and 30?  Why don't you add them together first? That will make the problem much simpler!
💡 Hint 3:  Hey there,  see if you can add 45 and 30 together first!  That will make the problem a bit easier to solve.
💡 Hint 1:  Hey there!  Think about what number you could put in place of 'a' to make the whole equation true.  Try to get '2a' by itself first – what's the opposite of adding 3?
💡 Hint 2:  Think about what number you could put in place of 'a' that, when you multiply it by 2 and then add 3, would give you a total of 9.  Try working backwards!
💡 Hint 1: Hey there!  See if you can add the two sevens together first. That might make the problem a bit easier!
